title: Understanding Positive Symptoms
text: Positive symptoms of schizophrenia are those that add to the person's experience, such as hallucinations and delusions. These are not present in individuals without the disorder.

title: Examples of Positive Symptoms
text: Positive symptoms include hallucinations, delusions, and thought disorders. These symptoms are considered 'positive' because they are added to the individual's mental state.

hintAnswer: symptoms that are “added” to a person who is nonpsychotic. These include any changes to behaviors or thought content, consisting of excessive, distorted thoughts and perceptions and the presence of symptoms, including hallucinations and delusions
title: Identifying Positive Symptoms
text: Which of the following is a positive symptom of schizophrenia?
choices: symptoms that are “added” to a person who is nonpsychotic. These include any changes to behaviors or thought content, consisting of excessive, distorted thoughts and perceptions and the presence of symptoms, including hallucinations and delusions

symptoms that involve the “subtraction” or lessening of normal functions being “taken away” or are in deficit, such as behaviors that the individual is no longer demonstrating, including cognitive decline, apathy, anhedonia, and so forth
